Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: EllenDelller
Reviews.Content: Our go-to place in Berlin. Very clean and comfortable (fantastic FIRM beds), relatively inexpensive for a big city, fresh and ample buffet breakfast, good coffee, and an in-hotel bar that stays open really late and is a cozy place to end the day. Mostly youthful or young-at-heart clientele. Just around the corner (really about 90 seconds!) from trains and buses, but very quiet. Get a room on a higher floor, and you'll have an exhilarating view of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was part of the sex industry”
Reviews.Author: The_Peppin-Hugheses
Reviews.Content: We popped in for a drink while we were checking out the East Side gallery and honestly thought the hotel was a sleazy motel due to the soft porn pic's everywhere. Thankfully, it turned out to be a decent place for a beer, non sleazy, nice friendly barman although a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap is expensive :(”
Reviews.Author: Gee k
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my girlfriend as we were trying to stay longer in berlin so our options based on looking something affordable which made us consider this hotel as our option. starting with the one side of the coin,First of all,the hotel is ok, as its close to the train stations, so getting to the city centre or any part of berlin is a click on your finger tips,(big up for that), secondly, the hotel staffs were really really friendly and helpful, and thirdly, the breakfast was good over the hotel value. The other side of the coin is, The room they first gave us was less more value than a cheapest hostel you can ever imagine, but we complained on it then they gave us a top floor which was ok looking room, and those are the one you see on their hotel room images. other problem with the hotel was about the bed since it was kind of broken as you feel better sleep on the floor (since they dont have sofas in the rooms as you see on the picture) rather than the bed we found in the room. also there is no wifi internet reach in the top floor, so we were suppose to go down the bar/restaurant to get a wifi and this was such a disappointment i most felt. also the room TV have less than 4 boring germany channels only. another thing is the noice from the main road since their windows are not sound proof which forced us to wakeup early everyday as u can not sleep more than 6am and it was also supported with the sun light getting all in your room since the curtains were so thin. Therefore, i recommend this hotel to high school teenagers or something like that but not for couples or other backpackers since we found out that, in berlin there are alot other cheap hotels worthing the price.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for, and a little more”
Reviews.Author: tieler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our stay while running the Berlin Marathon in 2011. The location is fine, its near clubs and restaurants although a little outside the center of Berlin. Its very close to transport so no compaints. The rooms are basic but clean. My only complaint would be that there are no blackout blinds so you wake up when the sun comes up. The staff are very good and friendly and helpful. The breakfast was really good and theres a good atmosphere in the bar in the evenings. Overall good option for a budget weekend but budget is the word!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: thisnan
Reviews.Content: The East Side Hotel is a good Hotel for the price. It is in a trendy neighborhood full of nightlife and convenient to the train station. Our room had lovely view of the parking lot of a construction equipment company, but I don't travel to stay in the hotel room either. The only problem is that they're moving equipment pretty early each morning. The hotel is reasonably clean, not perfect, but you're not paying for a four star hotel either. I would skip the breakfast. It says they have wifi in all the all rooms, but we could only get anything useful in the lobby or bar. One word of caution, there's no air conditioning and no screens, which is not unusual, but it can be a problem if you are outrageously allergic to insect bites like me it can be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Trendy Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rumba2
Reviews.Content: I paid 60 Euros for three adults including breakfast. The rooms are large and clean with bath and a shower. TV in the room has premium Sky channels for 11.5 Euros per day. FREE high speed wi fi in every room. Good food and bar, 3.2 Euros for a large beer. Friendly, helpful staff, great views of the wall and the river. Expect road noise if staying at the front overlooking the wall. I highly recomend this Hotel, fantastic vaue for money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book via DayDreams (Hotelbon)”
Reviews.Author: Rolier
Reviews.Content: Don't let the cheap menu's fool you (max. 17 euro), because if you book via Daydreams (or Hotelbon) you get charged a fixed price for breakfast and diner of 43,50 euro per person. This is approx. twice the price if you eat a la carte, including drinks. They don't tell you this in advance. The surprise is yours when settling the account. Beside this we experienced an apprentice cook, because one evening the dinner looked and tasted different. Which was confirmed by the waiter.On three evenings there was no salad available. The mattresses in our room were rather thin, one could feel the springs through them. We complained to Hotelbon (Daydreams) without avail. They say they are not responsible for the product they sell. Rolier

Reviews.Title: “Being part of the neighbourhod...”
Reviews.Author: MRLG
Reviews.Content: Easy-going small trendy hotel with lots to do in the area. The reception and restaurant staff were very helpful and friendly. Ask for a room facing the street... not overly noisy, and a great view of the East Side Gallery of the Berlin Wall (the other side faces a parking lot). The room was a good size, including a large bathroom, so no issue trying to put stuff away as to not trip over it. The restaurant got 2 thumbs up for its breakfast buffet and evening meals as well (I say this with confidence since my wife is a trained chef and she really loved it!).

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: StockportGaribaldi
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and needless to say thankfully it was still the same old friendly hotel. The price at 78euros pn for a twin room incl breakfast was very good for money. The hotel is opposite the East Side gallery and only a 5min walk from the U bahn. We flew into Schonfield so the S9 train takes about 25mins to reach the hotel and is a great location to explore Berlin. Day tickets are EUR6.10 and much easier and cheaper than taxis. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast served until 11.30am which is great if you want a late night out. The hotel has a bar which is open 24hours so convienient for beer or food but at the same time it retains a quiet ambience. The room was basic but clean and and good value for money and no problems with shower/water. The area around the hotel feels safe and the river next to the old Berlin Wall is perfect for taking a relaxing stroll. The nearby Simon dach Strasse (10mins walk) is a lively street full of good bars & restaurants and well recommended. Ask for direction as it is not easy to find at first. The O2 World arena has recently opened near the hotel so excellent for those attending a concert there. Would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to get out and about around Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: x0man0war
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and spacious, neat and clean. I booked a double bed, my room had a cupboard, sofa, and a large bathroom with a bath/shower toilet. my friends who had ordered two singles in a room, didn't have as big of a bathroom nor a sofa. I had a view of the river spree which is opposite the hotel. Staff are very helpful and friendly. breakfast is from 6 till about 10, and serves a nice breakfast to cater for all tastes. It's perfectly located. less then 25 minutes to either Schoenefeld and Tegel airports by taxi. To get to famous landmarks i.e Brandenburg Gate will take 15 minutes by taxi. train stations Schlesisches Tor and Warschauer Straße are 5 minutes away. Schelesische Straße is a road in the the local area, 5 minutes walk away from the hotel. it's full of bars, clubs, and cafe culture. there are some great restaurants on this street to cater for every taste and include a couple of late night fast food places after a night on the town. Club matrix is just around the corner which is a huge club. there are some great places locally to hang out drink and chat with people. the hotel was brilliant and i would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Not happy.”
Reviews.Author: NunnuHelsinki
Reviews.Content: Almost everything went wrong with our visit to the hotel. We asked for a twin bed, which we did not get, and we had a lovely wiew of the parking lot (!) from our room. The tap didn´t function properly and you had to wait for 15 minutes to get warm water from the shower. There were also some nightly problems: the walls were paper thin and the hotel was filled with very noisy young people. Also, in the midlle of the night, I was waken up by an unpleasant cigarette smell from the downstairs restaurant. If I have to say something positive, the staff was okay and the breakfast was fairly good. Also, I liked the retro-feel of the hotel, which was one of the reasons we decided to go there on the first place.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water & The Toilet Did Not Work!”
Reviews.Author: SpoonSalesman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night (thankfully) and although the room itself was pleasant, the decor interesting and the breakfast buffet good we did have major bathroom issues!! On arriving we wanted to freshen up and have a shower but there was no hot water! After complaining to reception they said 'Oh yes there is a problem and the plumber has been called'. They did not mention this when we checked in 30 minutes previously! On returning to the room we then found the toilet would not flush! Neither problem was fixed when we returned after our evening out even though we were assured they would be! So at 1am we asked to change rooms at which stage the receptionist (very helpfully, I may add) came to the room and fixed the toilet herself! By morning the shower was lukewarm, certainly not warm enough to have a shower in Berlin in February though!! I liked the hotel but hot water and a working toilet are basics which I expect as standard so for that reason I would not choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “got there too late”
Reviews.Author: ultramusique
Reviews.Content: we arrived kinda late, and they had given away our reservation. but the staff put us up in another one of there hotels nearby, the gold hotel, and even paid for our cab fare. the gold hotel ended up being very nice. i'd say the staff at east side hotel was more than friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamYorkshire_England
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay, 10 minutes walk from all forms of transport easy access to anywhere in Berlin. Hotel was clean and tidy, breakfast was good and the staff are very friendly. The only downside, the rooms had no tea/coffee facilities and no hairdryer!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and spacious with a nice big bathroom (with genuine bath!) and comfortable beds. Windows look out on the East-side Gallery (substantial reminder of the old Berlin wall) and the River Spree. The management are friendly and helpful and there is a very good buffet breakfast which goes way beyond the ubiquitous coffee and (often stale) pastries you get at most hotels in this price range. Could do with a small fridge in the room and airconditioning as I needed to open the windows at night which can make it a bit noisy. Would definitely recommend this one to anyone wanting good value accommodation in an interesting part of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but neighborhood still has it's Cold War charm.”
Reviews.Author: forthbridge
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the East Side on my way through Berlin to Poland. The hotel itself is quite nice, but like many areas in the former east, the surrounding area is run down, though very lively at night. The club accross the way is great for the yonger crowd, but a little noisy if you have a train to catch the next morning. The East Side in convienent to both the S and U-Bahn, and about a 10 minute hike along the East Side Gallery from the OstBahnhopf. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

HotelInfo.Name: East Side City Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Muhlenstrasse 6, 10243 Berlin, Germany
